update.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-108: Create UI to display SRC tasks data](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-108). 

A new link in the left menu was added. This routes to `/src-results`, which displays data from each `srcsimulations` resource. Each one contains 5 rounds that contain 3 tasks, along with a Score and Total Time fields. These elements are collapsible.

The data of the task is displayed in a natural format, using a custom format behavior. A task is considered "Waiting" when no starting time has been provided.

Note that current resources only have one round and one task. They should be passed as an array. In the current implementation, they need to be converted to an array.

New elements:

* `cs-srcresults` contain the `srcsimulations` resources.
* Each round of the simulation is passed into a `cs-srcroundresult` element, that contain the information of that round. The fields will be implemented in [CLOUD-124](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-124).
* A `cs-srctasks` element manages each task.
* `cs-formatter-behavior` is an element that provides a [behavior](https://www.polymer-project.org/1.0/docs/devguide/behaviors) for displaying data in a natural way. This helps to avoid repeated code between elements that present data.

ptal  @andres_fortier 

Screenshots:

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1798032423-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png')
update.title: Task Data UI

content.raw: As the [Update SRC monitor with new Task and Score data](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/63/update-src-monitor-with-new-task-and-score/diff)** **PR is merged, I will proceed to merge this one. Thank you for the comments @andres_fortier , @preyna and @chapulina !
content.html: As the Update SRC monitor with new Task and Score data PR is merged, I will proceed to merge this one. Thank you for the comments @andres_fortier , @preyna and @chapulina !

content.raw: Thanks for the quick work! Yup, I think it's helpful for teams to know the penalty hasn't been increased for that task
content.html: Thanks for the quick work! Yup, I think it's helpful for teams to know the penalty hasn't been increased for that task

content.raw: Included penalties in [this commit](#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/commits/b8eba6095b656c62931b718ef43fac60f177b6e9). Also removed the notify property of elements, as it is not needed. I hope this helps @chapulina
content.html: Included penalties in this commit. Also removed the notify property of elements, as it is not needed. I hope this helps @chapulina

content.raw:
What do you think? Is the penalty necessary to show if it's zero?

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496690904295.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2726157706-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496690904295.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496690904295.png')
content.html: What do you think? Is the penalty necessary to show if it's zero?

content.raw:
Yes and yes.

Your example looks good to me, thanks! Red sounds perfect.

Note that there is one more penalty than checkpoint durations, because you'll also get the penalty for the checkpoint they're currently running, but haven't completed yet.
content.html:
Yes and yes.

Your example looks good to me, thanks! Red sounds perfect.

Note that there is one more penalty than checkpoint durations, because you'll also get the penalty for the checkpoint they're currently running, but haven't completed yet.

content.raw:
Ok! I have some questions about the penalties though.

Are they time values as well? Each checkpoint has an associated penalty?

I think it would be difficult to display them side by side, but what about below?

For example:

    Checkpoint 1     0:00:12.123
    Penalty          0:00:01.234
    Checkpoint 2     0:00:12.123
    Penalty          0:00:01.234
    ...

Penalty could be in red.
content.html:
Ok! I have some questions about the penalties though.

Are they time values as well? Each checkpoint has an associated penalty?

I think it would be difficult to display them side by side, but what about below?

For example:

Checkpoint 1     0:00:12.123
Penalty          0:00:01.234
Checkpoint 2     0:00:12.123
Penalty          0:00:01.234
...

Penalty could be in red.

content.raw: It would be nice to display penalties somewhere, probably best near the checkpoint
content.html: It would be nice to display penalties somewhere, probably best near the checkpoint

content.raw:
Thanks for all the changes, it's looking nice!

Just some usability nitpicks: 

* the cursor could change as you hover over the headers, so the user knows they're clickable to expand
* the items only expand if you click on the text, but it would be more intuitive if you could click anywhere on the header
content.html:
Thanks for all the changes, it's looking nice!

Just some usability nitpicks:

  • the cursor could change as you hover over the headers, so the user knows they're clickable to expand
  • the items only expand if you click on the text, but it would be more intuitive if you could click anywhere on the header

content.raw:
If passed, they can be accessed without being defined. Still, they are not being used and should be removed.

I saw that this also happens on `cs-srckiosk`, should we remove those unused parameters there?
content.html:
If passed, they can be accessed without being defined. Still, they are not being used and should be removed.

I saw that this also happens on cs-srckiosk, should we remove those unused parameters there?

content.raw: When a constellation is created, the number for rounds is used. I was using the number for the simulation resource and not the round.  I'll change this! Thanks!
content.html: When a constellation is created, the number for rounds is used. I was using the number for the simulation resource and not the round. I'll change this! Thanks!

content.raw: All team names start with SRC. Thanks!
content.html: All team names start with SRC. Thanks!

content.raw: if possible let's start using `let/const` instead of `var`
content.html: if possible let's start using let/const instead of var

content.raw: The code looks good to me German, thanks!  I just left a couple of minor comments/questions
content.html: The code looks good to me German, thanks! I just left a couple of minor comments/questions

content.raw: Question: in the new title `Team-XXX` does the XXX match the title/number when we create a new constellation ? (ie. the tabs in the other screen)
content.html: Question: in the new title Team-XXX does the XXX match the title/number when we create a new constellation ? (ie. the tabs in the other screen)

content.raw: minor: as per completion , shouldn't we also define here the other arguments that are passed to this element ? (eg. authurl, keysurl, issrcadmin) . Actually , are those authurl keysurl etc used here  ?
content.html: minor: as per completion , shouldn't we also define here the other arguments that are passed to this element ? (eg. authurl, keysurl, issrcadmin) . Actually , are those authurl keysurl etc used here ?

content.raw:
Thanks @andres_fortier and @chapulina ! I addressed your comments:

* Reversed the order of the simulations. Most recent simulations are shown first.
* Changed the default title to "team-XXX", where team is going to be a field of the simulator data and XXX is the resource number. If the team is undefined, it shows the old title "srcsimulations-XXX". PR for this is [here](#!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/pull-requests/91/add-team-name-to-srcsimulation-resource/diff). Thanks a lot @chapulina !
* Show when there are no rounds for the constellation.
* Imported Moment library to handle time conversions from seconds to H:mm:ss. This is only for display.
* General cleanup.

ptal @preyna and @chapulina 

Some screenshots of the changes:

* Team name using mock data.

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411234014.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/751759355-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411234014.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411234014.png')

* No tasks message. Notice that since the "team" parameter in the simulation is undefined, it's simulation name is shown.

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411294440.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/4146662499-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411294440.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411294440.png')

* Tasks

    ![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411315750.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3408249573-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411315750.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496411315750.png')

    

‌
content.html:
Thanks @andres_fortier and @chapulina ! I addressed your comments:

  • Reversed the order of the simulations. Most recent simulations are shown first.
  • Changed the default title to "team-XXX", where team is going to be a field of the simulator data and XXX is the resource number. If the team is undefined, it shows the old title "srcsimulations-XXX". PR for this is here. Thanks a lot @chapulina !
  • Show when there are no rounds for the constellation.
  • Imported Moment library to handle time conversions from seconds to H:mm:ss. This is only for display.
  • General cleanup.

ptal @preyna and @chapulina

Some screenshots of the changes:

  • Team name using mock data.

  • No tasks message. Notice that since the "team" parameter in the simulation is undefined, it's simulation name is shown.

  • Tasks

‌

content.raw: Does the team name includes "SRC-" or should it be appended to it?
content.html: Does the team name includes "SRC-" or should it be appended to it?

content.raw: That was fast! Thanks a lot @chapulina !
content.html: That was fast! Thanks a lot @chapulina !

Soon there will be

#!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/pull-requests/91/add-team-name-to-srcsimulation-resource/diff

With that PR, the srcsimulation resource should have both the srcround-XXX resource name and the team name. The GUI can combine both to create SRC-team-XXX like the kiosk does here

content.raw: @chapulina is there a simple way to get the team name from a simulation (I would also like to avoid doing an http request per simulation to get the name). Just wondering if it would be better to attach the team name to the simulation record on the server instead of the client having to fetch them one by one. What do you think?
content.html: @chapulina is there a simple way to get the team name from a simulation (I would also like to avoid doing an http request per simulation to get the name). Just wondering if it would be better to attach the team name to the simulation record on the server instead of the client having to fetch them one by one. What do you think?

content.raw: Maybe display the start time instead of yes or no?
content.html: Maybe display the start time instead of yes or no?

content.raw: The titles like `srcsimulations-011` don't mean much to the users. When they start a constellation, on the kiosk, each constellation is given a unique name in the format `<team_name>-XXX`, displayed on the tab. Do you think we could use that same name here, so they can cross-check which results came from which constellation?
content.html: The titles like srcsimulations-011 don't mean much to the users. When they start a constellation, on the kiosk, each constellation is given a unique name in the format <team_name>-XXX, displayed on the tab. Do you think we could use that same name here, so they can cross-check which results came from which constellation?

content.raw: How about displaying a message like "No tasks were run for this constellation."? Right now it's a bit puzzling why some elements don't expand on click.
content.html: How about displaying a message like "No tasks were run for this constellation."? Right now it's a bit puzzling why some elements don't expand on click.

content.html: Suggestion: call it just "Results", it's more compact and transmits the idea
